title: Brits Old Stomping Grounds
name: Brits Old Stomping Grounds
description:
A Map by Bbroke

Where I grew up.

properties.name: 7-Eleven
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke The famous Tsawwassen 7-11. Where the clerks were practically the youth counsellors. Whenever we were at a party, or meeting or something someone would call out "sev-run!" and off we\'d go for slurpees and candy. Usually on foot and at 3am.

properties.name: BC Ferries
properties.description: Posted by BbrokeThe Tsawwassen Ferry terminal. When people ask "where\'s Tsawwassen?" I respond "It\'s the town you drive past when going to the Ferries". They immediately go "Ah, okay. Yeah never actually gone there then."

properties.name: Beach Grove Beach
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke  This is where we used to go mud-flatting. The beach sometimes froze in the winter - not any more though. I used to follow the dike from here to Boundary Bay Airport.

properties.name: Beach Grove Corner Store
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke   When I was really little I used to ride my bike here and by 5cent candies.

properties.name: Beach Grove Elementary
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke  My elementary school.

properties.name: Centennial Beach
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke  In Boundary Bay, this beach is much busier than the one in Beach Grove, but has a really fun playground. I used to go sit on the merry-go-round even as a teenager. Good bikeride too.

properties.name: Dieffenbaker Park
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke  Mel and I would ride our bikes up here, or sometimes I would walk up here and sit in the park under my favorite tree. It\'s a nice spot during the summer and it has turtles in the pond.

properties.name: Fred Gingell Park
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke  When David drove me home from school, sometimes we would stop here to talk and look out over the Ferry Terminal.

properties.name: MarketPlace
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke The grocery store in Point Roberts that we\'d sometimes go to.

properties.name: My House
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke 1665 58A street, delta, bc, canadaThis is my parents home, where I grew up. My dad bought this place from his Dad.

properties.name: Safeway
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke 1143 56 Street, Delta, BC, CanadaThis is the Tsawwassen Safeway. The Safeway used to be where the Shoppers Drug Mart now is, but moved in my last year of high-school. One year Safeway went on strike, and the community realized how dependant many were on this grocery store, which was the only one in the town at the time.

properties.name: South Delta Secondary School
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke 750 53 Street, Delta, BCMy high-school. There used to be two buildings, the North Campus (shown) and the South Campus (which was demolished and replaced by a housing development). The South Campus was orginally Tsawwassen Junior Secondary School, and was just south of the SDSS track.

properties.name: The Boarder Crossing
properties.description: Posted by BbrokeThis is the boarder crossing to Point Roberts. My grandparents used to live down there, but mostly we\'d go for cheap gas and milk at MarketPlace.

properties.name: Thrifty Foods
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke1207 56 Street, Delta, BC, Canada Thriftys came to Tsawwassen in my last year of high-school. It\'s a great store, with way better produce than Safeway. This was the first Thriftys on the mainland. The year before Thriftys store was built, they had a two-story tall green shopping cart in the Sun-Festival parade that got a standing ovation by the audience as it passed. Only in Tsawwassen eh?

properties.name: Tim Hortons
properties.description: Posted by Bbroke1211 56 Street, Delta, BC, CanadaThis was built after I moved out of Tsawwassen, but we lobbied hard to get something other than the 7-11 open 24 hours in our community.

properties.name: US Post Office
properties.description: Posted by BbrokeThis is where we\'d sometimes go to mail american letters and to check my grandparents post-office box.
